parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post mentions Corneliu Mureșan, a candidate for the Senate, and implicitly refers to other candidates from AUR, POT, and Forța Dreptei.  While not explicitly naming all candidates, the context clearly points to specific individuals running for office.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content is not a private message but rather a news article shared publicly.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. The post highlights a candidate from Alba County running for Senate, contrasting him with "parachute" candidates from other counties. This comparison could be interpreted as an attempt to sway voters towards Mureșan by emphasizing his local roots. The overall tone suggests a positive portrayal of Mureșan, potentially influencing voters' choices.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post links to a news article, suggesting a journalistic approach. However, the selection of this particular article and its promotion as a paid advertisement raise questions about its objectivity. The focus on a specific candidate, even within a news context, blurs the line between journalism and electoral propaganda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes a news article that presents information in a way that could be considered favorable to a specific candidate.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1103675518078138</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while linking to a news article, functions as electoral propaganda due to several factors.  It specifically highlights a candidate for the Senate, Corneliu Mureșan, in a positive light, contrasting him with other candidates. The paid nature of the Facebook post, targeting a specific demographic in Alba County, amplifies its potential to influence voters. Although the linked article might be considered journalistic, its promotion as a paid advertisement by Radio HIT FM Alba transforms it into a tool for electoral campaigning. The post's objective appears to be increasing support for Mureșan by emphasizing his local connection.  The counter-argument is that the post simply shares a news article; however, the context of a paid advertisement during the election period strongly suggests an intention to influence the vote.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Corneliu Mureșan</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Radio HIT FM Alba</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Radio HIT FM Alba, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin promovarea plătită pe Facebook a unui articol care prezintă într-o lumină favorabilă candidatul la Senat Corneliu Mureșan, contrastându-l cu alți candidați, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024.  Postarea, cu ID-ul 1103675518078138,  a fost vizualizată de 6.000-7.000 de persoane, având o estimare a acoperirii de 50.000-100.000,  și a costat mai puțin de 100 RON.  Efectul electoral este clar, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea lui Corneliu Mureșan prin sublinierea legăturii sale cu județul Alba.  Utilizarea unei platforme publice precum Facebook, combinată cu plata pentru promovare, demonstrează intenția de a influența alegerile.  Textul postării, care menționează explicit candidatul și îl prezintă într-o manieră pozitivă, în contextul apropiat de încheierea campaniei electorale, constituie o încălcare clară a legislației.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
